title: My advice to people in ranked (champion select)
body:
(I'm only silver, so this only applies to that level of play) 
And I'm being full serious here:

In champ select, just don't give a shit about people, please, it does everyone a favour.
If you are 2nd pick and you want jungle, just take it.
If you are first pick and your mid who is last pick wants Yas, please don't try to secure him for them and then trade. 
If someone is crying about being supp, let them cry, don't try change positions with them.

If you want jungle, but last pick says "Jungle please, i suck at everything else" For the love of god, don't switch positions to keep them happy, because its 85% certain that some dick will chose jungle instead, and now neither of you get jungle and no-one is happy. 

I know you're a nice guy and want to help, i want to help too, but there is nothing worse than someone trying to help out by securing Yas, then the other person has absolutely no champs to trade, and so you're stuck with a Supp Yas who doesnt know how to play Yas and a Mid Yas main who cant play any other champs who is now playing some random champ they have never used before but refuses to let the other guy play mid. 

If someone is moaning about be being supp and you quickly change to supp just before the timer ends, it ALWAYS ends up with someone going AP nami mid, or Jax supp or some other bs like that, because they arent as fast as you at changing champs and you both get stuck with the same type of champ. 

The key to winning is being as nice as possible in game, and being the biggest dick possible in champ select.
if you are pre-made and can talk to eachother then great, ignore everything i just said, but if you're dealing with the cesspool of everyone else, then just don't give a fuck about anyone. 
its ruthless and it hurts to do it, but nothing is worse than Yas Supp who has no idea how to play Yas, and AP nami mid who refuses to switch with Yas and an adc and top who are moaning the while game because they tried to give jungle to eachother and someone else swooped in and took it anyway. 

i am guilty of helping, and i have royally screwed up games because of it, and I've had other people royally screw it up as well.

Just always remember:
if you try to help other people in champ select (at least at silver level) you are just as much of a menace to the team as the person you are trying to help.

replies.body: I would run down your mid lane and feed them 40 kills if you made me play bot lane. Worst advice ever.
Or....you just ignore everyone and pick and possibly instalock the champ / lane you want. Also 99% of "pre-made" (feeders) botlane teams feed anyway.
